intro: Callicarpa lasiantha, commonly known as the Chinese beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its clusters of vibrant violet to purple berries that ripen in the fall. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in partial to full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant. The berries are not only visually striking but also attract birds and other wildlife, contributing to ecological diversity.
